docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
The following site contains technical information for interfacing with the supported systems.

Note: This site is heavily work in progress and may contain outdated/incorrect information. Please make sure to check your requests before performing them on your device

docs.title: Get a list of supported operations
docs.text: 1. Open http://<MODULE IP>:8181/ in your browser to see a complete list of supported operations.

docs.title: Send Requests
docs.text:
URL: http://<MODULE IP>:8181/remote/json-rpc

Method:: POST

Body:

{
    "params": <Method.Parameters>,
    "jsonrpc": "2.0",
    "method": <Method.Name>,
    "id": 1
}
  • A list of supported methods and their parameters can be found under the Methods section
  • Parameter order does matter so make sure to check the order of the parameters in the parameters section

docs.title: Description
docs.text: This method enables SSH access to the module

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text:
• params[0] Your user code/installer code
  • params[1] Enable SSH access

docs.title: Description
docs.text: This method returns the API version of the module.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: This method does not take any parameters.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: This method returns the battery level of the panel.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: This method does not take any parameters.

docs.title: Example Response
docs.text:
{
    "id": 1,
    "jsonrpc": "2.0",
    "result": 100
}
  • result - The battery level of the panel in percent.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: This method returns how the module is connected

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: This method does not take any parameters.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: This method returns the panel's current date

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: This method does not take any parameters.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: This method returns the panel's current date AND time

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: This method does not take any parameters.

docs.title: Example Response
docs.text:
{
    "id": 1,
    "jsonrpc": "2.0",
    "result": "20231107224814"
}
  • result - The current date and time in the format YYYYMMDDHHMMSS

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Returns all configuration information for a device.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text:
• params[0] PowerG Device type ID
  • params[1] Device ID

docs.title: Description
docs.text: This method returns all device information for the panel. This includes all sensors, keyfobs, etc.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: This method does not take any parameters.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: This method returns all status information for a device.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text:
• params[0] PowerG Device type ID
  • params[1] Device ID

docs.title: Example Response
docs.text:
{
    "id": 1,
    "jsonrpc": "2.0",
    "result": {
        "id": 3,
        "statuses": {
            "acTrouble": false,
            "alarm": false,
            "bypassZone": false,
            "cleanMeTrouble": false,
            "coldAlert": false,
            "freezerAlert": false,
            "freezingAlert": false,
            "heatAlarmTrouble": false,
            "hotAlert": false,
            "lowBattery": false,
            "maskingTrouble": false,
            "notUpdated": false,
            "oneWayTrouble": false,
            "open": false,
            "smokeAlarm": false,
            "smokeTrouble": false,
            "supervisionTrouble": false,
            "tamperMemory": false,
            "tamperTrouble": false,
            "zoneTrouble": false
        },
        "type": 3
    }
}

docs.title: Description
docs.text: This method returns the EEPROM version of the panel.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: This method does not take any parameters.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: This method returns information for a zone location.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: This method returns the maximum number of devices for a particular device type that can be added to the system.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: This method returns the maximum number of devices per type that can be added to the system.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: This method does not take any parameters.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: This method returns all configuration information for the panel.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: This method does not take any parameters.

docs.title: Example Response
docs.text:
{
    "id": 1,
    "jsonrpc": "2.0",
    "result": {
        "abortTime": 1,
        "bypassArmMode": "MANUAL_BYPASS",
        "duressCode": "0000",
        "eepromVersion": {
            "eeprom_model": 7,
            "eeprom_sub_model": 174
        },
        "entryDelay1": 30,
        "entryDelay2": 60,
        "exitDelay": 30,
        "gprsEnrolled": false,
        "kidsComeHomeEnabled": false,
        "latchkeyEnabled": true,
        "panelId": "0AAA0A",
        "partitionEnabled": false,
        "plinkVariant": "adtuk",
        "plinkVersion": "7.5.58",
        "pmaxDefaultVersion": "J-703883 I20.214",
        "pmaxVersion": "JS703642 I20.214",
        "quickArmEnabled": false,
        "viewOnDemand": "VIEW_IN_ALL_MODES",
        "viewOnDemandTimeWindow": "ALWAYS"
    }
}

docs.title: Description
docs.text: This method returns information on the panel's state for a particular partition

docs.title: Description
docs.text: This method returns information on partitions and the panel's current status

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: This method does not take any parameters.

docs.title: Example Response
docs.text:
{
    "id": 1,
    "jsonrpc": "2.0",
    "result": {
        "datetime": "20231107225917",
        "partitions": [
            {
                "partition": 1,
                "state": "DISARM",
                "statuses": {
                    "activeBit": true,
                    "alertBit": false,
                    "bypassBit": false,
                    "fireBit": false,
                    "instantBit": false,
                    "latchkeyBit": false,
                    "memoryBit": false,
                    "needEngResetBit": false,
                    "readyBit": true,
                    "troubleBit": false
                }
            }
        ],
        "statuses": {
            "acTrouble": false,
            "communicationFailure": false,
            "enrollingModeBit": false,
            "fuseTrouble": false,
            "jammingTrouble": false,
            "lineFailure": false,
            "lowBattery": false,
            "noActive": false,
            "tamperMemory": false,
            "tamperTrouble": false
        }
    }
}

docs.title: Description
docs.text: This method returns all the user codes for a particular user.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text:
• params[0] Your user code you use to arm + disarm the panel
  • params[1] The user ID you want to get the codes for

docs.title: Description
docs.text: This method returns all the user codes for the panel

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: • params[0] Your user code you use to arm + disarm the panel

docs.title: Description
docs.text: This method returns the panel's current connection status

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: This method does not take any parameters.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Enables or disables the debug mode of the panel. Note: This is not supported on my panel.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text:
• params[0] Your installer code
  • params[1] Debug mode true/false

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Sets the state of the panel. For example, if you're looking to arm/disarm your panel, you would use this method

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text:
• params[0] Your user code you use to arm + disarm the panel
  • params[1] The state you want to set your panel - AWAY, HOME, DISARM
  • params[2] The partition you want to set the state of (Requires clarification)
  • params[3] Unknown (Requires clarification)
  • params[4] Unknown (Requires clarification)
